title: Front-end draft UI for student exam registration with multiple sleek theme versions

requirements.text: Create a concise front-end draft (no backend integration) for a student exam registration website with a minimal number of screens and clear user flow: Landing/Start, Exam Selection, Registration Details, Review, and Confirmation.

quotes: I need a website that is mean't for students to register for exams.
BUT ONLY CREATE THE FRONT-END I dont need a fully working website, just a draft.

acceptanceCriteria: App can be run as a static front-end with no required backend calls.
User can navigate through a complete exam-registration flow: start -> select exam -> enter details -> review -> confirmation.
All data is mocked/held in client state only and resets on refresh.

requirements.text: Implement multiple design variations and a way to preview/switch them in the UI: (1) at least one dark-only theme and (2) at least one theme that demonstrates color theory (intentional complementary/analogous palette) while keeping the layout concise, straight to the point, and sleek.

quotes: It needs to be concise, straight to the point, and sleek, I would like to see different versions. Some with only dark colors, some with color theory at work.

acceptanceCriteria: There are at least 2 distinct visual theme variants available (>=1 dark-only and >=1 color-theory-based).
Theme switching/preview is possible without rebuilding the app (e.g., toggle/selector in UI).
Typography, spacing, and component styling remain consistently sleek and minimal across variants.

requirements.text: Design the exam registration form UI with realistic fields and client-side validation only (no persistence): student name, student ID, email, exam selection, date/time (or session), accommodations (optional), and agreement checkbox; include clear inline validation and a disabled/enabled submit state.
acceptanceCriteria: Form contains the specified fields with sensible input types (e.g., email input).
Client-side validation errors are shown inline and are understandable in English.
The primary action button reflects validity (disabled until required fields are valid or equivalent clear behavior).

requirements.text: Provide a coherent, distinct visual direction for the app (layout grid, typography scale, spacing system, and component hierarchy) and apply it consistently across all screens, avoiding overly decorative elements.

quotes: concise, straight to the point, and sleek

acceptanceCriteria: Screens share a consistent layout structure (header/content/actions) and spacing scale.
Primary/secondary actions are visually clear and consistent across screens.
UI remains uncluttered with a clear information hierarchy on each screen.

requirements.text: Ensure the UI is responsive and accessible for a draft: usable on mobile and desktop, keyboard navigable for core flow, and with sufficient contrast in each theme variant.
acceptanceCriteria: Core flow is usable at common widths (mobile and desktop) without broken layout.
Interactive elements can be reached/activated via keyboard navigation for the primary flow.
Text and interactive elements have acceptable contrast in both dark-only and color-theory themes.

constraints: Front-end only: do not build or require a working backend, persistence, or real exam data.
Do not modify any files under the immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT (compose existing UI components instead).
Use English for all user-facing text.
nonGoals: Internet Identity authentication or any login system.
Storing registrations on-chain or in any database/canister state.
Admin dashboards, exam management CRUD, or real payment flows.
Email/SMS notifications or integrations with external services.
